title: First Schedule
description: Lists the States and Union Territories of India and their territorial extent.

title: Second Schedule
description: Deals with salaries, allowances, and privileges of constitutional authorities.

title: Third Schedule
description: Contains forms of oaths and affirmations for constitutional offices.

title: Fourth Schedule
description: Provides allocation of seats in the Rajya Sabha to States and Union Territories.

title: Fifth Schedule
description: Administration and control of Scheduled Areas and Scheduled Tribes.

title: Sixth Schedule
description: Administration of tribal areas in Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura, and Mizoram.

title: Seventh Schedule
description: Division of powers between Union, State, and Concurrent Lists.

title: Eighth Schedule
description: Lists the official languages recognized by the Constitution.

title: Ninth Schedule
description: Protects certain laws from judicial review.

title: Tenth Schedule
description: Contains provisions relating to disqualification of legislators on grounds of defection.

title: Eleventh Schedule
description: Lists subjects under the Panchayati Raj Institutions.

title: Twelfth Schedule
description: Lists subjects under Municipalities.

title: First Constitutional Amendment Act, 1951
description: Added reasonable restrictions to Fundamental Rights and protected land reform laws by introducing the Ninth Schedule.
impact: Limited absolute Fundamental Rights in public interest.

title: Second Constitutional Amendment Act, 1952
description: Adjusted representation of states in Parliament.

title: Third Constitutional Amendment Act, 1954
description: Modified allocation of seats in State Legislative Councils.

title: Fourth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1955
description: Restricted property rights and amended compensation provisions.

title: Fifth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1955
description: Provided procedure for consultation with states regarding boundary changes.

title: Sixth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1956
description: Amended taxation provisions related to interstate trade and commerce.

title: Seventh Constitutional Amendment Act, 1956
description: Implemented States Reorganisation and restructured Union and State territories.

title: Eighth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1960
description: Extended reservation of seats for SCs and STs in legislatures.

title: Ninth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1960
description: Added land reform laws to the Ninth Schedule.

title: Tenth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1961
description: Incorporated Dadra and Nagar Haveli into the Indian Union.

title: Eleventh Constitutional Amendment Act, 1961
description: Provided that the election of the Vice-President shall not be challenged on the ground of vacancy in the electoral college.
impact: Ensured continuity in the office of the Vice-President.

title: Twelfth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1962
description: Incorporated the territories of Goa, Daman and Diu into the Indian Union.

title: Thirteenth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1962
description: Provided special status to the State of Nagaland under Article 371A.
impact: Protected customary laws and autonomy of Nagaland.

title: Fourteenth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1962
description: Incorporated Pondicherry into the Indian Union and created Legislative Assemblies for certain Union Territories.
impact: Expanded democratic governance in Union Territories.

title: Fifteenth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1963
description: Raised the retirement age of High Court judges from 60 to 62 years.

title: Sixteenth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1963
description: Made it obligatory for public office holders to swear allegiance to the sovereignty and integrity of India.

title: Seventeenth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1964
description: Added more land reform laws to the Ninth Schedule.
impact: Protected agrarian reform laws from judicial review.

title: Eighteenth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1966
description: Provided for reorganisation of the State of Punjab and related territorial adjustments.

title: Nineteenth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1966
description: Abolished election tribunals and transferred election disputes to High Courts.
impact: Strengthened judicial handling of election disputes.

title: Twentieth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1966
description: Validated certain appointments and judgments relating to Goa, Daman and Diu.
impact: Provided legal continuity during territorial transition.

title: Twenty-First Constitutional Amendment Act, 1967
description: Included Sindhi as an official language in the Eighth Schedule.

title: Twenty-Second Constitutional Amendment Act, 1969
description: Provided for the creation of autonomous states within the State of Assam.

title: Twenty-Third Constitutional Amendment Act, 1969
description: Discontinued reservation of seats for SCs and STs in Nagaland and Meghalaya.
impact: Adjusted reservation provisions for specific states.

title: Twenty-Fourth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1971
description: Affirmed Parliament’s power to amend Fundamental Rights under Article 368.

title: Twenty-Fifth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1971
description: Restricted the right to property and replaced the term 'compensation' with 'amount'.
impact: Reduced judicial scrutiny over property acquisition.

title: Twenty-Sixth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1971
description: Abolished privy purses and special privileges of former princely rulers.
impact: Ended royal privileges and promoted equality.

title: Twenty-Seventh Constitutional Amendment Act, 1971
description: Provided reservation of seats in legislatures for Union Territories.

title: Twenty-Eighth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1972
description: Removed special privileges related to civil servants’ service conditions.

title: Twenty-Ninth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1972
description: Placed certain land reform laws of Kerala into the Ninth Schedule.

title: Thirtieth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1972
description: Amended provisions relating to appeals to the Supreme Court in civil cases.

title: Thirty-First Constitutional Amendment Act, 1973
description: Reduced the voting age from 21 to 18 years.

title: Thirty-Second Constitutional Amendment Act, 1973
description: Provided special provisions for the State of Andhra Pradesh.

title: Thirty-Third Constitutional Amendment Act, 1974
description: Modified resignation provisions of MPs and MLAs.

title: Thirty-Fourth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1974
description: Added land reform laws of various states to the Ninth Schedule.

title: Thirty-Fifth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1974
description: Granted status of Associate State to Sikkim.

title: Thirty-Sixth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1975
description: Made Sikkim a full-fledged State of India.

title: Thirty-Seventh Constitutional Amendment Act, 1975
description: Provided legislative assembly and council of ministers for Arunachal Pradesh.

title: Thirty-Eighth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1975
description: Made Emergency proclamations immune from judicial review.

title: Thirty-Ninth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1975
description: Placed election disputes of key constitutional offices beyond judicial scrutiny.

title: Fortieth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1976
description: Placed certain central and state laws in the Ninth Schedule.

description: Raised retirement age of Chairmen and Members of Tribunals.

title: Forty-Second Constitutional Amendment Act, 1976
description: Introduced Fundamental Duties and strengthened Centre’s powers.

description: Restored judicial review curtailed by the 42nd Amendment.

description: Restored Fundamental Rights and made Emergency provisions stricter.

title: Forty-Fifth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1980
description: Extended reservation of seats for SCs and STs.

title: Forty-Sixth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1982
description: Allowed states to tax sale of goods in specific cases.

description: Added land reform laws to the Ninth Schedule.

description: Extended President’s Rule in Punjab.

title: Forty-Ninth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1984
description: Provided reservation of seats for Tripura Tribal Areas.

title: Fiftieth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1984
description: Exempted certain service posts from UPSC consultation.

title: Fifty-First Constitutional Amendment Act, 1984
description: Provided reservation of seats for SCs and STs in Meghalaya, Nagaland, Arunachal Pradesh, and Mizoram.

title: Fifty-Second Constitutional Amendment Act, 1985
description: Introduced the Anti-Defection Law through the Tenth Schedule.

title: Fifty-Third Constitutional Amendment Act, 1986
description: Provided special status to Mizoram under Article 371G.
impact: Protected customary laws and social practices.

title: Fifty-Fourth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1986
description: Increased salaries of Supreme Court and High Court judges.

title: Fifty-Fifth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1986
description: Provided special provisions for Arunachal Pradesh under Article 371H.

title: Fifty-Sixth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1987
description: Conferred statehood on Goa and created the Union Territory of Daman and Diu.

title: Fifty-Seventh Constitutional Amendment Act, 1987
description: Extended reservation of seats for SCs and STs in legislatures.

title: Fifty-Eighth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1987
description: Authorised the Hindi version of the Constitution as authoritative.

title: Fifty-Ninth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1988
description: Empowered the government to impose Emergency in Punjab.

title: Sixtieth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1988
description: Increased professional tax ceiling from ₹250 to ₹2,500.

title: Sixty-First Constitutional Amendment Act, 1989
description: Reduced voting age from 21 to 18 years.

title: Sixty-Second Constitutional Amendment Act, 1989
description: Extended reservation of seats for SCs and STs.

title: Sixty-Third Constitutional Amendment Act, 1990
description: Repealed the special provisions related to Punjab Emergency.

title: Sixty-Fourth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1990
description: Extended President’s Rule in Punjab.

title: Sixty-Fifth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1990
description: Established the National Commission for SCs and STs.

title: Sixty-Sixth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1990
description: Added land reform laws of states to the Ninth Schedule.
impact: Protected agrarian reforms from judicial review.

title: Sixty-Seventh Constitutional Amendment Act, 1990
description: Extended reservation of seats for SCs and STs.

title: Sixty-Eighth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1991
description: Added certain land reform laws to the Ninth Schedule.

title: Sixty-Ninth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1991
description: Provided special status to the National Capital Territory of Delhi.

title: Seventieth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1992
description: Allowed inclusion of Union Territories in Presidential elections.

title: Seventy-First Constitutional Amendment Act, 1992
description: Included Konkani, Manipuri, and Nepali in the Eighth Schedule.

title: Seventy-Second Constitutional Amendment Act, 1992
description: Extended reservation of seats for SCs and STs in legislatures.

title: Seventy-Third Constitutional Amendment Act, 1992
description: Constitutionalised Panchayati Raj Institutions.

title: Seventy-Fourth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1992
description: Constitutionalised Urban Local Bodies (Municipalities).

title: Seventy-Fifth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1994
description: Provided for Rent Control Tribunals.

description: Protected Tamil Nadu’s reservation law under the Ninth Schedule.

title: Seventy-Seventh Constitutional Amendment Act, 1995
description: Provided reservation in promotion for SCs and STs.

title: Seventy-Eighth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1995
description: Added state land reform laws to the Ninth Schedule.

title: Seventy-Ninth Constitutional Amendment Act, 1999
description: Extended reservation of seats for SCs and STs.

title: Eighty-First Constitutional Amendment Act, 2000

title: Eighty-Second Constitutional Amendment Act, 2000

title: Eighty-Sixth Constitutional Amendment Act, 2002

title: Eighty-Seventh Constitutional Amendment Act, 2003

title: Eighty-Eighth Constitutional Amendment Act, 2003
description: Established Service Tax under the Union taxation powers.

title: Eighty-Ninth Constitutional Amendment Act, 2003

title: Ninetieth Constitutional Amendment Act, 2003
description: Reserved seats for socially and educationally backward classes in Assam.

title: Ninety-First Constitutional Amendment Act, 2003

title: Ninety-Second Constitutional Amendment Act, 2003
description: Included Bodo, Dogri, Maithili, and Santhali in the Eighth Schedule.

title: Ninety-Third Constitutional Amendment Act, 2005
description: Enabled reservation for OBCs in educational institutions including private unaided ones.

title: Ninety-Fourth Constitutional Amendment Act, 2006

title: Ninety-Fifth Constitutional Amendment Act, 2009

title: Ninety-Sixth Constitutional Amendment Act, 2011
description: Substituted Odia for Oriya in the Eighth Schedule.

title: Ninety-Seventh Constitutional Amendment Act, 2011
description: Granted constitutional status to cooperative societies.

title: Ninety-Eighth Constitutional Amendment Act, 2012
description: Empowered the Governor of Karnataka with special responsibility for Hyderabad-Karnataka region.

title: Ninety-Ninth Constitutional Amendment Act, 2014
description: Provided for National Judicial Appointments Commission (NJAC).

title: Hundredth Constitutional Amendment Act, 2015
description: Gave effect to land boundary agreement between India and Bangladesh.

title: One Hundred and First Constitutional Amendment Act, 2016
description: Introduced Goods and Services Tax (GST).

title: One Hundred and Second Constitutional Amendment Act, 2018
description: Granted constitutional status to National Commission for Backward Classes.

title: One Hundred and Third Constitutional Amendment Act, 2019
description: Provided 10% reservation for Economically Weaker Sections (EWS).
impact: Expanded reservation based on economic criteria.

title: One Hundred and Fourth Constitutional Amendment Act, 2019
description: Extended SC/ST reservation in legislatures and ended Anglo-Indian nomination.

title: One Hundred and Fifth Constitutional Amendment Act, 2021
description: Restored states’ power to identify OBCs.

title: One Hundred and Sixth Constitutional Amendment Act, 2023
description: Provided reservation for women in Lok Sabha and State Legislative Assemblies.
